result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig J Ganther was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages unless has written approval from Agent. 
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with Michaele Scott, Claude Scott, or Kristy Shulfer. 
Defendant shall not go upon the premises of the apartment complex of Michaele Scott and Claude Scott.

Defendant shall take prescription medications in the manner and method as prescribed by physician. 
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

C: Defendant, DOC
Elements

Defendant Craig J Ganther in court with attorney Andrew W. Boden. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest plea to 15CM410 Count 1. 
No contest plea to 15CM406 counts 1 & 2. 
State has not complied with victim notifications on 15CM406. 
Victim on phone for 15CM410. 
Court accepts his pleas and finds defendant guilty. 
Count 2 in 15CM410 is dismissed and read in. 
Statements by the victim. 
Recommendations by DA Snider and Atty Boden. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 2 years probation, concurrent all counts. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs including DOMAB 
- pay supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess/consume any alcoholic beverages unless has written approval from agent 
- take prescription medications in the manner and method as prescribed by physician 
- no contact directly/indirectly with Michaele Scott, Claude Scott or Kristy Shulfer 
- not go upon the premises of the apartment complex of Michaela/Claude Scott 
Defendant may be discharged after 1 year if satisfied all conditions of Probation. 
Advised of appeal rights.
Status conference on March 30, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Request by Atty. Boden to reschedule, defendant has no ride
Status conference at 03-17-2016 10:00 am
Per Br. 2, rescheduling STC @ 03/17/16 @ 10:00 AM
Status conference at 02-12-2016 11:30 am

Defendant: Present

Court finds defendant is competent to proceed in both files.
Plea Not Guilty
Bond continued.
